results.title: Merely Mr. Hawkins
results.creator_credit: Maclean Rogers, George Smith and Carlyle Pictures
results.brief_description: A light British comedy about the daughter of a small town bank clerk coming into an inheritance which makes her life the target for a charming con-man, who fools her and her shrewish mother into believing him to be a Canadian millionaire. Flighty eventuality ensues.

results.title: Meo Village: Family life
results.brief_description: Shows the life style of people in one particular Meo village in Thailand. Stresses the Meo concept of the extended family with the grandparents and other relatives living under the same roof and explains the interdependence of each member of the family.
results.description: Shows the life style of people in one particular Meo village in Thailand. Stresses the Meo concept of the extended family with the grandparents and other relatives living under the same roof and explains the interdependence of each member of the family.

results.title: Menzies in his time: Robert Gordon Menzies, 1894-1978
results.creator_credit: Steve Bowman and Steve Bowman Studio
results.brief_description: The program was produced to mark the centenary of Menzies’ birth and traces his political career and the changes which occured in Australia during his long leadership. The presentation uses archival material, personal home movies and photographs as well as newsreel and television footage spanning from the 1930’s to his death in 1978. A fascinating tribute to Australia’s longest serving Prime Minister.

results.title: Menura
results.creator_credit: Harold J. Pollock and Bank of New South Wales
results.brief_description: The superb lyre bird (Menura Novae Hollandiae) is one of the nest attractive and elusive of Australian wildfowl. It is shy in habit and has a unique ability to mimic bird, animal and human sounds. Shows the male bird giving a display on a dancing mound; details of nesting; the emergence of the fledgling from the nest; and its later song rehearsals.

results.title: Menu
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the relationship of sensible food to energy and growth by using a playful litter of pups from the kennel s of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. Half the litter is fed properly and half on food lacking certain elements; the difference soon becomes apparent. The nutritional value of the foods in a balance diet are explained.

results.title: Mentally handicapped children growing up
results.brief_description: An experiment at Brooklands. Contrasts overcrowded ward in a public hospital where hard worked staff have no time to train the children in self-help and the family activity style of training at Brooklands. Small groups with a ‘mother’ learn some independence by living together as families; the active outdoor life enables them to become more and more independent.

results.title: Mental patients' association
results.creator_credit: Richard Patton, John Taylor, Peter Jones, Shelah Reljic and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The Mental Patients Association was set up to deal with mental patients in the period immediately after discharge from hospital. They have established a “drop-in” centre to help patients in this transitory period. Interviews members of the association, discusses the problems encountered in a mental hospital. Shows the work and activities of the association.

results.title: Menopause: the truth, the rumours and you
results.creator_credit: Margaret Slaght, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and The National and The Journal
results.brief_description: An international award winning two part documentary featuring Germaine Germaine Greer which explores myths and misconceptions about menopause, the common problems women experience and investigates alternative therapies.

results.title: Menopause: myths and realities
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Zedda Burnford and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: This program shows six women going through the various stages and experiencing the myriad of menopausal symptoms. The program is positive - solutions are offered and avenues for help are explored.

results.title: Mendel: father of genetics
results.brief_description: This film clearly demonstrates Mendel’s theory, which shows that characteristics are inherited according to a mathematical pattern having dominant and recessive strains, rather than through inheritance of acquired characteristics or blending of characteristics. Suitable for upper secondary levels.
